item.title: I love learning from failure, but these past couple months have been rough. If you've noticed my webpage has been down, my merch unavailable, or wondered why the book timeline changed—here's why. I had to stop everything and start over. New team. New syst

item.title: Building to that 300 mile week on December 1st. 310 miles run in the past 2 weeks. Damn this is hard. My body is like, I thought this was the off season. Week 300 schedule 12/1 - San Diego 12/2 - Coronado 12/3 - Santa Monica to Newport Beach 12/4 - work

item.title: #SolarayPartner I get blood work done twice a year to make sure everything in my body is where it should be. I am over 40 and I am a firefighter, so between long shifts, heavy training, and big ultramarathons, my body goes through a lot. Over the years I

item.title: While others are getting wasted on New Year's Eve, I'll be running into 2026. Literally. Just signed up for Across the Years in Arizona. It's a timed race on a loop course with options for everyone: 6 hours, 12 hours, 24 hours, 48 hours, 72 hours, or the
item.description: While others are getting wasted on New Year's Eve, I'll be running into 2026. Literally. Just signed up for Across the Years in Arizona. It's a timed race on a loop course with options for everyone: 6 hours, 12 hours, 24 hours, 48 hours, 72 hours, or the

item.title: Having my family at the finish line was the best moment of the entire week. I'm so incredibly blessed to have a family that supports me through every crazy idea and adventure. They don't just tolerate this—they show up, keep me alive, and cheer me on when

item.title: Pulled off the win although I had to really work for it. 100 miles/161 km does not come easily. Especially when the race starts at 6pm. Born to Run 100 miler was an incredible experience and I will be back. #runtok #ultramarathon #ultrarunner #borntorun
